entries.title: User Directory
entries.summary: Centralized view of all users from Google Workspace and Microsoft 365
entries.content:
The User Directory provides a unified view of all users across your connected platforms.

**Key Capabilities**:
- View all synced users from Google Workspace and Microsoft 365
- Search and filter by name, email, department, status
- View detailed user profiles with all attributes
- See group memberships and manager relationships
- Track user activity and login history

**Access**:
Navigate to Directory > Users from the main menu.

**Permissions**:
- Admins: View all users
- Managers: View their team members
- Users: View colleagues in the directory (if enabled)

entries.title: Group Directory
entries.summary: Manage and view all groups from connected platforms
entries.content:
The Group Directory shows all groups synced from your identity providers.

**Key Capabilities**:
- View all groups (security, distribution, mailing lists)
- See group members and their roles
- Filter by group type and source platform
- View nested group relationships
- See group email addresses and aliases

**Access**:
Navigate to Directory > Groups from the main menu.

**Permissions**:
- Admins: View and manage all groups
- Managers: View groups they manage
- Users: View their group memberships

entries.title: Organization Chart
entries.summary: Visual representation of your organization's reporting structure
entries.content:
The Organization Chart displays the reporting hierarchy of your organization.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Visual tree view of reporting relationships
- Navigate up and down the hierarchy
- Click users to see their profile
- Identify orphaned users (no manager)
- Export org chart data

**Access**:
Navigate to Directory > Org Chart from the main menu.

**Data Source**:
The org chart is built from manager relationships synced from Google Workspace or Microsoft 365.

entries.title: Google Workspace Integration
entries.summary: Connect and sync users, groups, and data from Google Workspace
entries.content:
The Google Workspace integration syncs your directory data to Helios.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Sync users and their attributes
- Sync groups and memberships
- Sync organizational units
- Real-time sync on changes
- Developer Console commands for GW operations

**Requirements**:
- Google Cloud service account with domain-wide delegation
- Admin email for impersonation
- Required API scopes enabled

**Access**:
Configure in Settings > Modules > Google Workspace.

entries.title: Microsoft 365 Integration
entries.summary: Connect and sync users, groups, and data from Microsoft 365
entries.content:
The Microsoft 365 integration syncs your Entra ID directory data to Helios.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Sync users and their attributes
- Sync groups and memberships
- Sync licenses and assignments
- Real-time sync on changes
- Developer Console commands for M365 operations

**Requirements**:
- Azure AD app registration
- Tenant ID, Client ID, and Client Secret
- Microsoft Graph API permissions with admin consent

**Access**:
Configure in Settings > Modules > Microsoft 365.

entries.title: Sync Engine
entries.summary: Automatic and manual synchronization of directory data
entries.content:
The Sync Engine keeps Helios data in sync with your identity providers.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Automatic sync at configurable intervals (5 min to daily)
- Manual sync on demand
- Conflict resolution settings
- Sync history and error tracking
- Delta sync for efficiency

**Access**:
Configure sync settings in Settings > Advanced.
View sync status on the Dashboard.
Trigger manual sync from Dashboard or Settings.

**Best Practices**:
- Enable auto-sync for real-time accuracy
- Review sync errors regularly
- Use delta sync for large directories

entries.title: Developer Console
entries.summary: Command-line interface for advanced Helios operations
entries.content:
The Developer Console provides a CLI-like interface for power users.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Execute Helios commands (gw users list, gw groups get, etc.)
- Query live data from connected platforms
- Debug and troubleshoot issues
- Access command history
- View detailed output with syntax highlighting

**Access**:
Navigate to Developer Console from the admin menu or press Ctrl+` anywhere.

**Commands**:
Type `help` to see all available commands.
Type `help <command>` for specific command help.

entries.title: AI Assistant
entries.summary: AI-powered help and command assistance
entries.content:
The AI Assistant helps you use Helios more effectively.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Answer questions about Helios features
- Suggest commands for tasks you describe
- Explain command syntax and options
- Help troubleshoot issues
- Provide context-aware help based on current page

**Access**:
Click the AI chat icon in the bottom right corner of any page.

**Limitations**:
- Read-only: Cannot execute commands or make changes
- Knowledge based on documented features
- Uses search tools to find accurate information

entries.title: Onboarding Templates
entries.summary: Reusable templates for new employee onboarding
entries.content:
Onboarding Templates streamline the new hire process.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Create reusable onboarding checklists
- Define group assignments for new hires
- Specify license requirements
- Include welcome email content
- Add training materials and links
- Schedule tasks for specific dates

**Access**:
Navigate to Lifecycle > Onboarding Templates.

**Usage**:
1. Create a template with all onboarding steps
2. Apply template when onboarding a new user
3. Track progress in Scheduled Actions

entries.title: Offboarding Templates
entries.summary: Reusable templates for employee departure workflows
entries.content:
Offboarding Templates ensure consistent departure procedures.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Define account suspension timeline
- Specify data transfer requirements
- Configure group removal
- Set up email forwarding
- Schedule license recovery
- Track compliance requirements

**Access**:
Navigate to Lifecycle > Offboarding Templates.

**Usage**:
1. Create templates for different departure scenarios
2. Apply template to departing users
3. Track completion in Scheduled Actions

entries.title: Scheduled Actions
entries.summary: View and manage scheduled user lifecycle actions
entries.content:
Scheduled Actions shows pending and completed lifecycle tasks.

**Key Capabilities**:
- View all pending actions with execution dates
- See completed actions history
- Cancel or modify pending actions
- Filter by action type and status
- Track action execution results

**Access**:
Navigate to Lifecycle > Scheduled Actions.

**Action Types**:
- Account suspension
- Group additions/removals
- License changes
- Email forwarding setup
- Data transfers

entries.title: Audit Logs
entries.summary: Comprehensive logging of all platform activity
entries.content:
Audit Logs track all significant events in Helios.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Log all user logins and logouts
- Track admin actions and changes
- Record configuration modifications
- Monitor API key usage
- Track sync events and errors
- Export logs to CSV

**Access**:
Navigate to Security > Audit Logs.

**Retention**:
Logs retained for 90 days (default). Enterprise plans support extended retention.

**Compliance**:
Helps with SOC 2, security investigations, and change management.

entries.title: Security Events
entries.summary: Monitor and respond to security-related events
entries.content:
Security Events highlights potential security concerns.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Detect failed login attempts
- Identify suspicious activity patterns
- Track API key usage anomalies
- Alert on configuration changes
- Monitor user status changes

**Access**:
Navigate to Security > Security Events.

**Response**:
- Review event details
- Take action on suspicious activity
- Export for investigation

entries.title: API Keys
entries.summary: Create and manage API keys for external integrations
entries.content:
API Keys enable programmatic access to Helios.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Create service keys for backend integrations
- Create vendor keys with limited permissions
- Set expiration dates
- Monitor usage in audit logs
- Rotate and revoke keys

**Access**:
Navigate to Settings > Integrations.

**Rate Limits**:
100 requests per minute per key (default).

**Security**:
- Keys shown only once at creation
- Store securely (never in code)
- Rotate regularly

entries.title: Dynamic Groups
entries.summary: Groups with automatic membership based on user attributes
entries.content:
Dynamic Groups automatically include users matching defined criteria.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Define membership rules based on user attributes
- Filter by department, location, job title, etc.
- Combine multiple conditions (AND/OR logic)
- Automatic membership updates on sync
- View calculated members

**Access**:
Navigate to Directory > Groups and create a new dynamic group.

**Use Cases**:
- All users in Marketing department
- All managers across the organization
- Users in a specific location
- Employees with specific job titles

entries.title: Dashboard
entries.summary: Overview of your organization with key metrics and quick actions
entries.content:
The Dashboard provides an at-a-glance view of your organization.

**Key Widgets**:
- User count by status (Active, Suspended, Deleted)
- Group statistics
- Recent sync status
- Quick actions
- Recent activity
- Module status

**Access**:
The Dashboard is the default landing page after login.

**Customization**:
Admins can customize which widgets are displayed.

entries.title: Active Users
entries.summary: Users who have completed setup and can access systems
entries.content:
Active users are fully provisioned users who can access your organization's systems.

**Characteristics**:
- Account setup is complete
- Can log in to connected platforms (Google Workspace, Microsoft 365)
- Have assigned licenses and group memberships
- Appear in the org chart and people directory

**Access**:
View active users by navigating to Directory > Users and selecting the 'Active' tab.

**Actions Available**:
- View user profile and details
- See group memberships
- Suspend user account
- Initiate offboarding
- Update user information

entries.title: Staged Users
entries.summary: Users who have been created but haven't completed account setup
entries.content:
Staged users are in a pending state, waiting to complete their account setup.

**How Users Become Staged**:
- Created via Quick Add before full onboarding
- Created through an approved HR request
- Imported but not yet activated
- Created in source platform but setup incomplete

**What Makes Them Different**:
- Cannot log in until setup is complete
- May be waiting for password setup
- May need additional provisioning steps
- Not yet synced to workspace platforms

**Completing Setup**:
- User receives setup email with password link
- Admin can send/resend setup invitation
- Admin can manually activate the account

**Connection to Requests**:
When an HR request (like 'New Employee Request') is approved, the user is typically created in 'staged' status until they complete onboarding.

**Access**:
View staged users by navigating to Directory > Users and selecting the 'Staged' tab.

entries.title: Suspended Users
entries.summary: Users whose access has been temporarily disabled
entries.content:
Suspended users have their access temporarily revoked but their accounts remain intact.

**Why Users Get Suspended**:
- Manual suspension by admin
- Part of offboarding process (before deletion)
- Security concern or policy violation
- Extended leave of absence
- Synced suspension from Google Workspace or Microsoft 365

**What Suspension Does**:
- Blocks login to Helios and connected platforms
- Preserves all user data and settings
- Retains group memberships (but access blocked)
- Keeps email and files intact

**What Suspended Users Can't Do**:
- Log in to any connected system
- Access email or files
- Appear in active org chart views

**Reactivating Users**:
Admins can reactivate suspended users at any time. The user regains full access with all previous settings preserved.

**Access**:
View suspended users by navigating to Directory > Users and selecting the 'Suspended' tab.

entries.title: Deleted Users
entries.summary: Users whose accounts have been marked for deletion
entries.content:
Deleted users have been removed from active use but may still be recoverable.

**Soft Delete vs Hard Delete**:
- **Soft Delete**: Account marked as deleted, can be recovered within retention period
- **Hard Delete**: Account permanently removed, no recovery possible

**What Happens on Deletion**:
- User cannot log in
- Removed from groups
- Licenses may be recovered
- Email access revoked
- Data may be transferred to another user

**Retention Period**:
- Default: 30 days for soft-deleted accounts
- Configurable in Settings > Security
- After retention period, accounts are purged

**Recovery Options**:
- Within retention: Admin can restore the account
- Data may be preserved even if account deleted
- Audit logs retained for compliance

**Sync Behavior**:
Users deleted in Google Workspace or Microsoft 365 are synced as deleted in Helios.

**Access**:
View deleted users by navigating to Directory > Users and selecting the 'Deleted' tab.

entries.title: Guest Users
entries.summary: External users with limited, time-bound access to your organization
entries.content:
Guest users are external people given limited access to your organization's resources.

**Typical Guest Use Cases**:
- Contractors and consultants
- Partner organization members
- Temporary project collaborators
- External auditors
- Vendor representatives

**Key Differences from Staff**:
- Have an expiration date
- Limited access permissions
- Not synced from workspace platforms
- Associated with a company/organization
- Don't count toward license quotas

**Guest Properties**:
- Name and email
- Company/organization affiliation
- Access level (what they can access)
- Expiration date (when access ends)
- Invited by (who created the guest)

**Access**:
View and manage guests by navigating to Directory > Users and selecting the 'Guests' tab.

**Creating Guests**:
Use Quick Add with 'Guest' user type selected.

entries.title: Contacts
entries.summary: External contact records for vendors, clients, and partners without system access
entries.content:
Contacts are external people stored for reference without giving them any system access.

**What Contacts Are For**:
- Vendor contact information
- Client/customer contacts
- Partner organization contacts
- External collaborators you work with
- Reference directory entries

**Key Differences from Users/Guests**:
- No login or system access
- No licenses assigned
- Not in org chart
- Not synced to workspace platforms
- For reference only

**Contact Properties**:
- Email (required)
- First name, last name
- Company/organization
- Job title, department
- Phone, mobile
- Contact type (vendor, client, partner, external)
- Tags for categorization
- Notes

**Access**:
View and manage contacts by navigating to Directory > Contacts tab.

**Creating Contacts**:
1. Go to Directory > Contacts
2. Click 'Add Contact'
3. Enter email and details
4. Select contact type
5. Add tags for organization

**Use Cases**:
- Store vendor support contacts
- Keep client contact info handy
- Maintain partner directory
- Build external address book

entries.title: Organization Domains
entries.summary: Manage email domains that belong to your organization for user classification
entries.content:
Organization Domains defines which email domains belong to your organization, used to classify users as staff or guests.

**How Domain Classification Works**:
- Users with email domains in your organization domains list are classified as 'staff'
- Users with email domains NOT in your list are classified as 'guests'
- Classification happens automatically when users are created or when domains change

**Domain Types**:
- **Primary**: Main organization domain (e.g., acme.com)
- **Alias**: Additional domains owned by the organization (e.g., acme.io, acme.co.uk)

**Managing Domains**:
1. Go to Settings > Organization
2. Scroll to 'Organization Domains' section
3. Add domains using the form
4. Remove alias domains (primary cannot be removed)

**Automatic Features**:
- Initial domains are seeded from existing user emails
- When domains are added, users are automatically reclassified
- When domains are removed, affected users become guests

**Use Cases**:
- Company with multiple brands/domains
- Merger/acquisition with new domains
- Distinguish internal staff from external guests

entries.title: Requests
entries.summary: HR and IT requests that require approval before action
entries.content:
Requests allow employees and managers to submit formal requests that need approval.

**Request Types**:
- **New Employee Request**: Request to hire a new team member
- **Access Request**: Request access to a group or resource
- **Equipment Request**: Request IT equipment or assets
- **Change Request**: Request updates to user information

**Request Workflow**:
1. Submitter creates request with details
2. Request routed to approver(s)
3. Approver reviews and approves/denies
4. If approved, action is executed (user created, access granted, etc.)
5. Submitter notified of outcome

**Connection to Staged Users**:
When a 'New Employee Request' is approved, a staged user account is created. The new hire then completes their account setup, moving from 'staged' to 'active' status.

**Access**:
Navigate to Automation > Requests to view and manage requests.

entries.title: Files & Assets
entries.summary: Built-in file storage for public assets, logos, and shared resources (MinIO-powered)
entries.content:
Files & Assets provides built-in file storage for your organization using MinIO.

**IMPORTANT**: This is Helios's own storage feature - completely independent from Google Drive or any workspace platform.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Upload and manage organization assets
- Host public files with shareable URLs (logos, documents, images)
- Organize files in folders
- Personal file storage for users (My Files)
- No Google Workspace or Microsoft 365 required

**Use Cases**:
- Organization logos and branding assets
- Public documents (policies, forms)
- Email signature images
- Shared resources for the team
- Template files and assets

**Access**:
- Navigate to Assets > Shared Files for public assets
- Navigate to Assets > My Files for personal storage

**Technical Details**:
- Powered by MinIO (S3-compatible storage)
- Self-hosted - your files stay on your infrastructure
- No external dependencies or API limits
- Works without any workspace integration

**NOT Google Drive**:
This feature is NOT connected to Google Drive. If you need to work with Google Drive files, use the Developer Console commands (gw shared-drives list, gw drive-transfer).

entries.title: Email Signatures
entries.summary: Create, manage, and deploy email signatures across your organization
entries.content:
Email Signatures allows you to create and deploy standardized email signatures.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Create signature templates with merge fields
- Deploy signatures to users automatically
- Track signature engagement (opens, clicks)
- Campaign mode for promotions
- Preview signatures before deployment

**Template Features**:
- Rich text editor
- Merge fields (name, title, phone, etc.)
- Insert images from Files & Assets
- HTML source editing
- Mobile-responsive designs

**Access**:
Navigate to Communication > Signatures.

**Requirements**:
- Google Workspace with Gmail signature API access
- Or Microsoft 365 with Exchange signature permissions

entries.title: Paranoid Mode
entries.summary: Tiered security protection against account compromise and insider threats
entries.content:
Paranoid Mode provides layered security protection with multiple levels.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Four security levels (Standard, Enhanced, Paranoid, Lockdown)
- Approval Group for dual-control verification
- SSO isolation for Super Admins
- 24-hour restrictions after password changes
- Automatic alerts for suspicious activity

**Protection Scenarios**:
- Compromised admin account
- Malicious insider
- Phishing attack on admin
- Unauthorized bulk changes
- Session hijacking

**Access**:
Navigate to Settings > Security to configure.

**Requirements for Paranoid Mode**:
- Approval Group with 2+ members
- Super Admins using Helios local auth
- MFA enabled for all admins
- Helios Teams configured

entries.title: Approval Group
entries.summary: Trusted personnel who verify and approve security-sensitive actions
entries.content:
The Approval Group provides dual-control verification for critical security actions.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Approve/deny sensitive admin actions
- Receive alerts via Helios Teams
- Emergency access for recovery
- Dynamic membership based on titles

**Who Should Be Members**:
- HR Director, CHRO
- CEO, COO, President
- CFO, Finance Director
- General Counsel
- NOT just IT/Super Admins

**Actions Requiring Approval**:
- Adding/removing Super Admins
- Disabling Paranoid Mode
- Deleting admin accounts
- Bulk user operations
- Changing security settings

**Access**:
Navigate to Settings > Security > Approval Group.

**Requirements**:
- Minimum 2 members
- At least 1 static (manual) member
- Not all can be Super Admins
- MFA required

entries.title: Helios Teams
entries.summary: Secure out-of-band communication channel for security coordination
entries.content:
Helios Teams provides a secure communication channel that works even when your workspace is compromised.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Secure messaging independent of Google/Microsoft
- Auto-created Security channel for alerts
- Approval request cards with Approve/Deny
- Real-time notifications
- Incident coordination during security events

**Why It Matters**:
When Google Workspace is compromised, work email cannot be trusted. Helios Teams uses separate Helios authentication, so it remains accessible.

**Auto-Created Channels**:
- **Security**: Approval Group + Super Admins
- **Admins**: All admins (general coordination)

**Security Alerts**:
- Password changes
- Failed login attempts
- Recovery code usage
- Paranoid Mode changes
- Bulk operations
- Lockdown triggers

**Access**:
Click the Teams icon in the header or navigate to Settings > Teams.

entries.title: Change Requests
entries.summary: Self-service requests for profile changes requiring approval
entries.content:
Change Requests allow users to request modifications to fields they cannot edit directly.

**Key Capabilities**:
- Request changes to job title, department, manager
- Automatic routing to HR or IT
- Track request status
- Approval workflow with notifications
- Changes sync to Google Workspace

**Requestable Fields**:
- Job Title (→ HR)
- Department (→ HR)
- Manager (→ HR)
- Location (→ HR)
- Primary Email (→ IT)
- Email Alias (→ IT)

**Workflow**:
1. User clicks 'Request Change' on profile field
2. Enters new value and reason
3. Request routed to appropriate approver
4. Approver reviews and approves/denies
5. If approved, change applied and synced
6. User notified of outcome

**Access**:
From your profile, click 'Request Change' next to non-editable fields.

**View Requests**:
Navigate to My Profile > My Requests to see request history.

entries.title: Self-Service Profile
entries.summary: Fields users can edit themselves without approval
entries.content:
The Self-Service Profile allows users to maintain their own information.

**User-Editable Fields**:

**Personal Information**:
- Nickname / Preferred Name
- Pronouns (he/him, she/her, they/them)
- Bio / About Me
- Profile Photo

**Contact Information**:
- Personal Phone
- Mobile Phone
- Emergency Contact

**Professional Details**:
- Professional Designations (CPA, PhD, CISSP)
- Certifications (with badges)
- Booking Link (Calendly, Cal.com)

**Social Links**:
- LinkedIn
- Twitter/X
- GitHub
- Personal Website

**Used For**:
- Email signatures (auto-populated)
- People directory
- Org chart profiles
- Internal collaboration

**Access**:
Click your avatar > My Profile to edit your information.

**Helios Advantage**:
Many of these fields (pronouns, booking link, certifications) are not available in Google Workspace API. Helios provides them for rich signatures.
